page.title: 03Village Magazine: FINTRY
page.content:
The community's newspaper is called { {The Focus}and provides an outlet for news not covered by commercial media. It is sold widely, wherever any of us Fintronians have settled.
Founded by the late Douglas Wilson in 1975, the quarto-sized Focus comes out 4 times a year. It usually contains 24 pages printed on a hand-operated duplicating machine. Collation is by moving round the table and the odd glass of wine!
Written and produced on a voluntary basis, it costs just 20p which covers the cost of production. Most people take out an annual subscription, which enables the producers to plan ahead.
The Focus has also printed tickets and programmes for village productions.
